net.xeoh.plugins.base.util
Class JSPFProperties

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
          java.util.Properties
              net.xeoh.plugins.base.util.JSPFProperties
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
public class JSPFProperties
extends java.util.Properties

Can be used to set properties more easily. Pass this object to the PluginManagerFactory's createPluginManager() method to set initial properties.

A good overview on how properties can be used is in the PluginConfiguration's documentation.

Author:
Ralf Biedert
See Also:

Constructor Detail

JSPFProperties

public JSPFProperties()
Method Detail

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.Class<?> root,
                        java.lang.String subkey,
                        java.lang.String value)
Sets a property using a class as prefix. For example, if GeoService is in the package com.company.plugins.geoservice the following call:

setProperty(GeoService.class, "remote.url", "http://geo.ip/q?");

would set the configuration key com.company.plugins.geoservice.GeoService.remote.url to the value http://geo.ip/q?.

Parameters:
root - Root class to set an option for.
subkey - The subkey to set.
value - The value to set.

getKey

public static java.lang.String getKey(java.lang.Class<?> root,
                                      java.lang.String subkey)
Assembles a key, only used internally.

Parameters:
root - Root class.
subkey - Subkey to assemble.
Returns:
The assembled key.
